utterances: Other callers encouraged us to think big.

Peter, let me ask you.
Do you check any of these - is there any, in your experience, to worry about in embedded computer chips in devices and things like that?
Quite a lot in the past.
I did not work with it myself, but I have some associates that have worked with testing medical equipment, and it's extremely tough.
If you have a heart-lung machine, you don't want it to stop, not even for a minute.
Hmm.
And some embedded chips cannot be easily tested.
However, I read that good - most of the hospitals have tested everything.

We're going to say goodbye, and a have a healthy and happy and a Merry Christmas.

We'll see you New Year's Eve in New York.
This is TALK OF THE NATION.
I'm Neal Conan in New York City this week for the start of the 65th United Nations General Assembly.
